So, prepare well using our List of Important Awards in India and international level pdf. We have also added the important sports awards in India, important literary awards in India, and important literature awards in India in this list of important awards 2024 article, important awards of football, important awards of volleyball, important awards of basketball, important awards of badminton, important awards and honours 2024 pdf, list of important awards in India for bank exams and list of important awards in India pdf. You can download this important awards in India pdf which is attached to this important awards in India page for your future reference.

National Film Awards 2024

Awards are something given to a recipient as a token of recognition of excellence in a certain field. Awards are given at the national and international levels. The national award in India is awarded by the government of India to people for their exceptional service or performance in different fields irrespective of their age, caste, occupation, religion, etc. Some of the awards at the national and international levels are the most popular. Many of them dream of achieving an award at least once in their lifetime. These international awards are from different fields with prize money offered by different countries and organisations. International awards list have garnered international fame and prestige. Check out the list of important awards in India pdf. You can use this important awards and honours 2024 pdf for your exam preparation. Important Awards in India - List of Most Prestigious Awards in India:

The list of most prestigious awards in India is explained in detail here. Civilian Awards and Gallantry Awards are the most prestigious awards in India. The civilian awards comprised of Bharat Ratna, Padma Vibhushan, Padma Bhushan & Padma Shri awards. The gallantry awards comprised of Paramvir Chakra, Mahavir Chakra, Vir Chakra, Ashok Chakra, Kirthi Chakra, and Shaurya Chakra awards.

Important Awards in India - Highest Civilian Awards in India:

The highest civilian award in India is "Bharat Ratna," which was established in 1954. These prizes are open to everyone without regard to race, profession, status, or sexual orientation.

It is given in honour of very excellent service or accomplishment in any area of human endeavour.

The Prime Minister personally recommends candidates for Bharat Ratna to the President. There is no need for official advice in this case.

There may only be a maximum of three yearly prizes given out in any one year.

The recipient of the award is given a medallion as well as a Sanad (certificate) that has been signed by the president.

The Award carries no reward of money.

List of Oscar Award Winners

List of Awards in India - Highest Gallantry Award in India:

Here we have given the complete details of the highest Gallantry Award in India for your reference.

Param Vir Chakra - India's highest military honour. Awarded for displaying courage in the face of a hostile force. The Victoria Cross, which was last awarded to an Indian during World War II, is equivalent to this.

Maha Vir Chakra - Maha Vir Chakra is the second-highest military decoration in India and is awarded for acts of conspicuous gallantry in the presence of the enemy, whether on land, at sea or in the air.

Vir Chakra - Third in precedence in the awards for wartime gallantry.

Different Civilian Awards In India: Highest Awards In India List

The civilian awards are given to recognised personalities in their field of work. These awards are presented to the respective recipients by the President of India on Republic Day. The civilian awards were introduced in 1954. For Padma awards, all persons without distinction of race, occupation, position or sex are eligible for these awards. However, Government servants including those working with PSUs, except doctors and scientists, are not eligible for these Awards. All nominations received for the Padma Awards are placed before the Padma Awards Committee, which is constituted by the Prime Minister every year. The Padma Awards Committee is headed by the Cabinet Secretary and includes the Home Secretary, Secretary to the President and four to six eminent persons as members. The recommendations of the committee are submitted to the Prime Minister and the President of India for approval. Civilian Awards are categorized according to the degree of honour. The civilian award of India are divided into 4 types such as,

Bharat Ratna - 1st degree of honour

Padma Vibhushan - 2nd degree of honour

Padma Bhushan - 3rd degree of honour

Padma Shri - 4th degree of honour

Gallantry Awards In India List: List of Awards In India

The Gallantry Awards are given upon conspicuous acts of bravery or valour or self-sacrifice in the presence of the energy. These gallantry awards are announced twice a year - first on the occasion of Republic Day and then on the occasion of Independence Day. Post-independence, the first three gallantry awards namely the Param Vir Chakra, the Maha Vir Chakra and the Vir Chakra were instituted by the Government of India on 26th January 1950 and were deemed to have effect from the 15th August 1947. Check out the list of gallantry awards in India 2024.

List of Awards in India: Awards In India For Sports

Sports awards in India are given by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports. It is done to enhance the player’s spirit and recognize his or her achievements. They are presented by the President of India in the same ceremony at the Presidential Palace, usually on 29 August. Here we have provided all the National Sports Awards of India. List of Awards in India: Film Awards In India

Dadasaheb Phalke Award is the only national award given in the field of cinema in India. It is India's highest award in the field of cinema. It is presented annually at the National Film Awards ceremony by the Directorate of Film Festivals, an organisation set up by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting. It is known as Dadasaheb Phalke as he is known as the Father of Indian Cinema and thus, the highest National Film Award was named after him in 1969. It comprises a Swarna kamal, a cash prize of Rs. 10 lakh and a shawl.

List of Awards in India: Literature Awards In India

Literary awards are those awards which are conferred to the authors and poets for a good piece of writing and their associated contributions towards the betterment of Indian Literature. This includes literature works in any officially recognized language of India including English as well. Many literary awards in India are as follows.

Importance of National Awards in India

The government of India recognizes people who have shown excellence in their field and dedication to service to society. Several civilian awards have been instituted by various Ministries/Departments/Agencies of the Government of India to recognize people who have excelled in their fields and worked with dedication for selfless service to society. Here we have added some points as to why giving these national awards is important. Check out below.

Awardees can win fame and encouragement to pursue their excellent work through different awards.

It makes people feel that their work is valued.

Recognition motivates people to do better work for society.

An award is nothing but a token of appreciation.

Getting awards from higher officials of the country encourages other persons to do wellness to society.

Bharat Ratna is the highest civilian award. Each citizen of India has the desire to achieve it for the outstanding work they have done in their respective fields and for society.

भारत में वीरता पुरस्कारों की सूची: भारत में पुरस्कारों की सूची

वीरता पुरस्कार, वीरता या आत्म-बलिदान के विशिष्ट कार्यों के लिए दिए जाते हैं। इन वीरता पुरस्कारों की घोषणा वर्ष में दो बार की जाती है - पहले गणतंत्र दिवस के अवसर पर और फिर स्वतंत्रता दिवस के अवसर पर। स्वतंत्रता के बाद, पहले तीन वीरता पुरस्कार अर्थात् परमवीर चक्र, महावीर चक्र और वीर चक्र भारत सरकार द्वारा 26 जनवरी 1950 को स्थापित किए गए थे और 15 अगस्त 1947 से प्रभावी माने गए थे। भारत में वीरता पुरस्कारों की सूची 2024 देखें।

भारत में खेलों के लिए पुरस्कारों की सूची

भारत में खेल पुरस्कार युवा मामले और खेल मंत्रालय द्वारा दिए जाते हैं। यह खिलाड़ी की भावना को बढ़ाने और उसकी उपलब्धियों को मान्यता देने के लिए किया जाता है। इन्हें भारत के राष्ट्रपति द्वारा राष्ट्रपति भवन में एक ही समारोह में प्रदान किया जाता है, आमतौर पर 29 अगस्त को। यहाँ हमने भारत के सभी राष्ट्रीय खेल पुरस्कार प्रदान किए हैं। खेलों में महत्वपूर्ण पुरस्कारों और स्थापना वर्ष के क्षेत्रों के साथ भारत में खेलों के लिए पुरस्कारों के बारे में जानें।

भारत में पुरस्कारों की सूची: भारत में फ़िल्म पुरस्कार

दादा साहब फाल्के पुरस्कार भारत में सिनेमा के क्षेत्र में दिया जाने वाला एकमात्र राष्ट्रीय पुरस्कार है। यह सिनेमा के क्षेत्र में भारत का सर्वोच्च पुरस्कार है। इसे सूचना और प्रसारण मंत्रालय द्वारा स्थापित संगठन, फिल्म महोत्सव निदेशालय द्वारा प्रतिवर्ष राष्ट्रीय फिल्म पुरस्कार समारोह में प्रस्तुत किया जाता है। उन्हें दादा साहब फाल्के के नाम से जाना जाता है क्योंकि उन्हें भारतीय सिनेमा के पितामह के रूप में जाना जाता है और इस प्रकार, 1969 में सर्वोच्च राष्ट्रीय फिल्म पुरस्कार उनके नाम पर रखा गया था।

इसमें एक स्वर्ण कमल, 10 लाख रुपये का नकद पुरस्कार और एक शॉल शामिल है।

भारत में फिल्म उद्योग पुरस्कार: भारत में सिनेमा पुरस्कार

भारत में फिल्म पुरस्कारों के नाम

भारत में साहित्य पुरस्कारों की सूची: भारत में साहित्य पुरस्कार

साहित्यिक पुरस्कार वे पुरस्कार हैं जो लेखकों और कवियों को उनके द्वारा लिखी गई अच्छी रचनाओं और भारतीय साहित्य की बेहतरी के लिए उनके योगदान के लिए दिए जाते हैं। इसमें अंग्रेजी सहित भारत की किसी भी आधिकारिक रूप से मान्यता प्राप्त भाषा में की गई साहित्यिक रचनाएँ शामिल हैं। भारत में कई साहित्यिक पुरस्कार इस प्रकार हैं।

List of International Awards - Top International Awards In Detail

The list of top international awards is provided here with in-depth information for competitive exam preparation. Everyone who is searching for an important international awards list must be aware of the important information related to that award. Here we have given the major international awards with detailed information.

List of Important International Awards - Nobel Prize

This is the most prestigious award in the world. It was set up in 1900 under the will of Alfred Bernhard Nobel. The Nobel Prizes are presented annually on December 10, the death anniversary of the founder. It is given in the fields of Peace, Literature, Physics, Chemistry, Physiology or Medicine (from 1901) and Economics (from 1969). Each Nobel Prize comes with SEK 9,000,000 (Swedish Krona) or around Rs 7 crore 22 lakh rupees.

Important International Awards: Grammy Awards

It is awarded for outstanding achievements in the music industry by the National Academy for Recording Arts and Sciences, America. It was started in 1959. Pandit Ravi Shankar has received the Grammy Awards three times.

List of Important International Awards: Pulitzer Prize

Pulitzer International Award was instituted in 1917 and named after US publisher Joseph Pulitzer. It is conferred annually in the United States. Pulitzer Prize is given in the field of accomplishments in journalism, literature and music.

List of Important International Awards: Magsaysay Awards

Magsaysay Awards is a major award instituted in 1957. It was named after Ramon Magsaysay, the former President of the Philippines. The award is given annually on August 31, the birth anniversary of Magsaysay, Magsaysay award is given for outstanding contributions to public service, community leadership, journalism, literature and creative arts and international understanding. It is given every year to individuals or organisations in Asia who manifest the same selfless service and transformative influence that ruled the life of the late and beloved Filipino leader. Magsaysay Award winners will each receive a certificate, a medallion bearing the likeness of the late President, and a cash prize.

Important Revolutions in India List

List of Important International Awards: Man Booker Prize

The Man Booker Prize honours only a single novel of an author, whereas the Man Booker International Prize recognises the entire body of work of an author instead of a single title. The Man Booker Prize is recognised as the leading prize for high-quality literary fiction written in English. Launched in 1969, it aims to promote the finest in fiction by rewarding the best novel of the year written in English and published in the United Kingdom. The winner of The Man Booker Prize receives 50,000 British pounds and trophy and, like all the shortlisted authors, a cheque for 2,500 British pounds and a designer bound copy of their book.

List of Important International Awards: Right Livelihood Award

The Right Livelihood Award was established in 1980. This major international award is also referred to as Alternative Nobel Prize. It is given to persons to honour those working on practical and exemplary solutions to the most urgent challenges facing the world today.

List of Important International Awards: Oscar Awards

On May 16, 1929, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences handed out its first awards, at a dinner party for around 250 people. The ceremony was held in the Blossom Room of the Roosevelt Hotel in Hollywood, California. The Indian films nominated for Oscars are Mother India (1957), Salaam Bombay (1988), and Lagaan (2001). Bhanu Athaiya was the first Indian to win an Oscar Award in 1982 for costume design in Gandhi Movie.

List of Important International Awards: UN Human Rights Award

This international award was instituted in 1966. It is given every five years for individual contributions to the establishment of human rights.

Baba Amte was the only Indian to have won the United Nations Award in the field of human rights.

FAQs - List of Important National And International Awards

Aspirants shall check the FAQs regarding Important National and International Awards in India for your reference.

Q. Magsaysay award is given in which field?

A. Magsaysay Award is given for outstanding contributions in public service, community leadership, journalism, literature and creative arts and international understanding.

Q. Which is the highest award in Indian Cinema?

A. Dadasaheb Phalke is the highest award in Indian Cinema.

Q. What are civilian awards?

A. Civilian Awards are conferred to people with outstanding achievements in their field of work. These awards are presented to the respective recipients by the President of India on Republic Day. The inception year of these Civilian awards is 1954.

Q. How many civilian awards are there in India?

A. Bharat Ratna, Padma Vibhushan, Padma Bhushan and Padma Shri are the four civilian awards.

Q. Dronacharya Award is given in which field?
